instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00239: What is 820-00239? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.U7000: What is U7000? U7000 refers to the ISL6258 or ISL6259 charging IC on Macbooks from 2008-2012.
definitions.CD3215: What is CD3215? This is a USB-C muxing chip responsible for USB-C communication with devices such as the laptop charger. The most common issue this chip is involved in is when a Macbook wonâ€™t charge or the charger is stuck at 5v instead of going to 20v..
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .
definitions.PP3V3_G3H: What is PP3V3_G3H? PP3V3_G3H is a 3.3v power line that is present when the machine is in a Global System Hardware Off state, and should come on before most other rails so that the USB-C circuitry can be powered for the charger.
definitions.PP1V1_UPC_XA_LDO_BMC: What is PP1V1_UPC_XA_LDO_BMC? PP1V1_UPC_XA_LDO is an LDO coming out of the CD3215 USB-C muxing chip. When this is missing, either a capacitor on the line has shorted, PP3V3_G3H is missing, or the CD3215 is bad..
definitions.ISL9239: What is ISL9239? This is a charging chip for Macbook motherboards from 2016-2018 responsible for charging the battery and creating the power rail PPBUS_G3H.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00239</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>
threads.message:
This plate is intervened from another workshop.

I don't have <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL>.

I already changed <CHIP>U7000</CHIP>

it has 5v in usb c test.

Present voltages:

<SIGNAL>PP3V3_G3H</SIGNAL>

The <CHIP>CD3215</CHIP> has its ldo except <CHIP>U3100</CHIP> and <CHIP>U3200</CHIP> does not have <SIGNAL>PP1V1_UPC_XA_LDO_BMC</SIGNAL>

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00239</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>
threads.message:
Each <CHIP>CD3215</CHIP> must get 1V1 LDO, when charger is connected to coresponding port.
Compare diode mode readings around <CHIP>CD3215</CHIP> chips between left/right sides.
Check for knocked off components, or broken trace.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00239</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>
threads.message:
I already have <SIGNAL>PP1V1_UPC_XA_LDO_BMC</SIGNAL> in the <CHIP>CD3215</CHIP> that I was missing.

I still don't have ppbus, is it necessary that smc is installed so that <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> is generated?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00239</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>
threads.message: Of course, <CHIP>ISL9239</CHIP> will not generate <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> untill talks with SMC.
